intro: Polycarpaea corymbosa var. diffusa, commonly known as the broadleaf polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in corymbs. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
